• Remember, women who have experienced sexual trauma or previous birth trauma may be particularly afraid
of the labour and birth experience.
o It is no t  always easy to recognise these factors in the women’s history.
o The fear can present as ‘aggression’ or ‘non-co-operation’ or ‘panic’ or withdrawal.
o Some of these women present in false labour or arrive late in labour.
o They especially need emotionally supportive care, focused on g
